metadata.synopsis: A dialogue with Hope - in person, not with the spirit form.First greeting is after players free her - she will start following the player after that as well.Later, after defeating Raphael, players can talk to Hope, ask who she is, why she was trapped and how's she connected to Raphael.
metadata.how_to_trigger: 1. CTY_Main_A2. Free Hope by destroying her chains with Orphic Hammer (or other cheaty means)teleport S_LOW_RealHope

11.speaker: Hope
11.text: Free. I never thought I would be, believed I could be, hoped I might be.
11.context: NodeContext: Triumphant, words spilling out of her in excited babble

32.speaker: Hope
32.text: But we must address the hollyphant in the room. I can see how you avoid looking at me. I must be so terribly mutilated after all these decades of torture.
32.context: NodeContext: composing herself on first sentence after an outburst. And then delivering lines solemnly, apologetic about her 'appearance', though it's not her fault

6.speaker: Hope
6.text: Don't hold back. Tell me how bad it is.

53.speaker: Hope
53.text: I'd blush if they had left me any skin to redden, and I would kiss you if they had not torn off my lips!

29.speaker: Hope
29.text: We both know that's not true, but thank you for being so kind.
29.context: NodeContext: with a sad smile - player is being kind to her, undeservedly as far as she knows

15.speaker: Hope
15.text: You truly are the kindest fool I've ever met.
15.context: NodeContext: pitying the player, despite her affection for them

27.speaker: Player
27.text: Seriously, there's nothing wrong with you. Physically, at least.

82.speaker: Hope
82.text: I hope that was a compliment.

9.speaker: Player
9.text: Let's just get out of here.

75.speaker: Hope
75.text: We'll carve our way to the entrance hall, and chop Raphael into messes.

20.speaker: Hope
20.text: That's the hopeful version, of course. The likely version is that WE ARE THE MESSES AND HE IS THE CHOPPER.
20.context: NodeContext: first sentence is her considering her previous optimiism, and then she delviers the pessimistic version with just as much manic glee

47.speaker: Player
47.text: Hideous. I can barely stand to look at you.

63.speaker: Hope
63.text: I shall find a breathable sack to wear on my noggin. But only after we escape.
63.context: NodeContext: accepting that somebody just told her she was hideous, and offering a solution that should be pleasing to everyone

26.speaker: Hope
26.text: It is absolutely preposterous that any of us are alive. Maybe we're not!

56.speaker: Hope
56.text: PINCH YOURSELF AND CHECK WE'RE NOT DREAMING THE LAST OF OUR LIVES AS WE DIE SCREAMING
56.context: NodeContext: intentional rhyme - afraid, but playful with the sing-song tone. she thought she'd just survived a terrible battle, and is now terrified that it was just a dream and she's still a prisoner

36.speaker: Hope
36.context: NodeContext: a short abrupt laugh, reacting to the player pinching themself at her command

38.speaker: Narrator
38.text: *You are wide awake, and Raphael truly is defeated.*

0.speaker: Player
0.text: We're fine, Hope. We did it.

12.speaker: Hope
12.text: Then we're not just fine, we're spectacular.
12.context: NodeContext: reassured and calm, heavy emphasis on 'spectacular' as a rare moment of joy

13.speaker: Hope
13.text: What a wonderful, jubilant, glorious day.

64.speaker: Hope
64.text: OH BUT MY POOR SISTER KORRILLA.
64.context: NodeContext: Sudden shock and grief, an outrburst of emotion

44.speaker: Hope
44.text: It is not right that she died, and it makes me want to weep an ocean.
44.context: NodeContext: quietly, composing herself after an outburst on the previous line. Holding back grief as best she can

81.speaker: Player
81.text: She made her choice when she sided with Raphael in the first place.

2.speaker: Hope
2.text: She was an entire person before she ever made that choice.
2.context: NodeContext: sad, grieving her lost sister

14.speaker: Player
14.text: I don't think there was any way to save her.

43.speaker: Hope
43.text: When we were children, she always kept the last piece of pastry for me, and bloodied the nose of the bullies who pulled my hair.
43.context: NodeContext: sad, grieving her lost sister

55.speaker: Hope
55.context: NodeContext: sad, grieving her lost sister, almost breaking into tears

1.speaker: Hope
1.text: But as a wise woman once said, there's no point in crying over spilt blood. We must go on.
1.context: NodeContext: trying to cheer herself up and to find some of her manic energy, but it's missing

30.speaker: Hope
30.text: And despite all the years I've lost, I have enough love in my heart to guide you home.
30.context: NodeContext: with genuine love and affection, with an undercurrent of grief

33.speaker: Narrator
33.text: *For the first time since you heard her voice, Hope seems calm. And the peace flows from her into you, soothing your very soul.*

5.speaker: Hope
5.text: And go where? I don't think I quite know how to be anywhere else but here anymore.
5.context: NodeContext: has undergone a fundamental change after losing her sister, and killing Raphael. Calm and collected, but with a heavy burden of grief alongside her optimism. She's feeling everything less intensely, but much more profoundly.

8.speaker: Hope
8.text: With a lick of paint and a thorough cleaning, this could be a lovely little house.
8.context: NodeContext: With a smile. Has undergone a fundamental change after losing her sister, and killing Raphael. Calm and collected, but with a heavy burden of grief alongside her optimism. She's feeling everything less intensely, but much more profoundly.

59.speaker: Hope
59.text: And I can hardly leave - after all, who would ever want to think of Hell without Hope?
59.context: NodeContext: has undergone a fundamental change after losing her sister, and killing Raphael. Calm and collected, but with a heavy burden of grief alongside her optimism. She's feeling everything less intensely, but much more profoundly.

71.speaker: Player
71.text: Where will you go now that you're free?

17.speaker: Hope
17.text: Nowhere but here. I don't quite think I know where anywhere else is anymore.
17.context: NodeContext: has undergone a fundamental change after losing her sister, and killing Raphael. Calm and collected, but with a heavy burden of grief alongside her optimism. She's feeling everything less intensely, but much more profoundly.

24.speaker: Hope
24.context: NodeContext: has undergone a fundamental change after losing her sister, and killing Raphael. Calm and collected, but with a heavy burden of grief alongside her optimism. She's feeling everything less intensely, but much more profoundly.

25.speaker: Hope
25.text: I hope I'll see Korrilla again one day, and that she'll say sorry, and I'll tell her she's forgiven.
25.context: NodeContext: has undergone a fundamental change after losing her sister, and killing Raphael. Calm and collected, but with a heavy burden of grief alongside her optimism. She's feeling everything less intensely, but much more profoundly.

54.speaker: Hope
54.text: I hope I'll find all the pieces of my mind that fell out of my head over all those years, and that I'll be able to put myself back together again.
54.context: NodeContext: has undergone a fundamental change after losing her sister, and killing Raphael. Calm and collected, but with a heavy burden of grief alongside her optimism. She's feeling everything less intensely, but much more profoundly.

40.speaker: Hope
40.text: I hope the echoes of pain will fade, and memories of sorrow will die, and that you'll visit me here some day.
40.context: NodeContext: has undergone a fundamental change after losing her sister, and killing Raphael. Calm and collected, but with a heavy burden of grief alongside her optimism. She's feeling everything less intensely, but much more profoundly.

4.speaker: Hope
4.text: And I hope you have a happy ending of your own.
4.context: NodeContext: a goodbye. has undergone a fundamental change after losing her sister, and killing Raphael. Calm and collected, but with a heavy burden of grief alongside her optimism. She's feeling everything less intensely, but much more profoundly.

62.speaker: Hope
62.text: I hope me and Korrilla can be a family again, that bygones can become bygones, and that we can patch up our wounds together.
62.context: NodeContext: sad and reflective, but optimistic

45.speaker: Hope
45.text: You were all the luck I needed.
45.context: NodeContext: has undergone a fundamental change after losing her sister, and killing Raphael. Calm and collected, but with a heavy burden of grief alongside her optimism. She's feeling everything less intensely, but much more profoundly.

76.speaker: Player
76.text: After all she did to you, she doesn't deserve your tears.

78.speaker: Hope
78.text: You don't know the half of what she did.
78.context: NodeContext: sad, grieving her lost sister

67.speaker: Hope
67.text: MY BEAUTIFUL SISTER IS MOSTLY INTACT

57.speaker: Hope
57.text: You could have broken her in half like a breadstick, but you didn't. I am sorry she fought you, and glad she survived.

60.speaker: Player
60.text: You're too forgiving. After all she did to you, we should have killed her.

51.speaker: Hope
51.text: She's my sister. I love her.

66.speaker: Hope
66.text: And despite all the years I've lost, I have enough love left for you as well. I hope it guides you home.
66.context: NodeContext: with genuine love and affection

58.speaker: Player
58.text: She was under Raphael's influence - she didn't deserve to die.

72.speaker: Hope
72.text: She deserves some of the blame - serving him was a choice.

10.speaker: Hope
10.text: But she was an entire person before she ever made that choice.

77.speaker: Player
77.text: I hope the two of you can reconcile.

23.speaker: Player
23.text: Incredible as it seems, we really did defeat Raphael.

61.speaker: Hope
61.text: That is incredible. We're incredible. We're spectacular.
61.context: NodeContext: reassured and calm, heavy emphasis on 'spectacular' as a rare moment of joy

69.speaker: Player
69.text: I expected him to put up more of a fight.

68.speaker: Hope
68.text: I was just about quite all right with the amount of fight he put up. If anything, I would have preferred less.

73.speaker: Hope
73.text: Are you still here, or are you but a dream?
73.context: NodeContext: lost in her own thoughts, but still happy to see the player

28.speaker: Hope
28.text: We need to grab your contract, quick as a hiccup, or Raphael will come and chew up your soul.

80.speaker: Hope
80.text: It's tempting to delay the inevitable, but this is it, the big showdown, the final act, the glorious RUIN THAT COMES TO US ALL.
80.context: NodeContext: increasing volume as she builds to a dramatic crescendo - really looking forward to this despite the very high possibility of failure

74.speaker: Hope
74.text: THERE IS ALSO THE SLIM POSSIBILITY THAT WE WIN
74.context: NodeContext: Trying to be positive, but has no rational reason to be
